simplenlg.realiser
Class NPPhraseSpec

java.lang.Object
  simplenlg.realiser.Spec
      simplenlg.realiser.PhraseSpec
          simplenlg.realiser.SyntaxPhraseSpec
              simplenlg.realiser.NPPhraseSpec
Direct Known Subclasses:
CoordinateNPPhraseSpec
public class NPPhraseSpec
extends SyntaxPhraseSpec

NPPhraseSpec is a very simple syntactic representation of a noun phrase.

It consists of

  • determiner
  • (head) modifier(s) (such as adjectives)
  • noun
  • (end) modifier(s) (such as prepositional phrases)
These are linearised in the above order

Also various simplenlg.features:

  • elided - realise as empty string
  • plural - NP is plural, inflect head appropriately
  • treatAsPlural - NP is plural, but do not inflect head

Author:
ereiter adapted by fhielkema December 2006

getHead

public String getHead()
Description copied from class: PhraseSpec
returns the head of a phrase.

Head depends on type; for example, the head of an SPhraseSpec is the verb.

Specified by:
getHead in class PhraseSpec
